ArticleTitle.sentence: Activation of nuclear factor kappa B in human lymphoblastoid cells by low-dose ionizing radiation.

event.clue: Activation of nuclear factor kappa B in human lymphoblastoid cells by low-dose ionizing radiation.

AbstractText.sentence: Nuclear factor kappa B (NF-kappa B) is a pleiotropic transcription factor which is involved in the transcriptional regulation of several specific genes.

event.clue: Nuclear factor kappa B (NF-kappa B) is a pleiotropic transcription factor which is involved in the transcriptional regulation of several specific genes.

AbstractText.sentence: Recent reports demonstrated that ionizing radiation in the dose range of 2-50 Gy results in expression of NF-kappa B in human KG-1 myeloid leukemia cells and human B-lymphocyte precursor cells; the precise mechanism involved and the significance are not yet known.

event.clue: Recent reports demonstrated that ionizing radiation in the dose range of 2-50 Gy results in expression of NF-kappa B in human KG-1 myeloid leukemia cells and human B-lymphocyte precursor cells; the precise mechanism involved and the significance are not yet known.

Recent reports demonstrated that ionizing radiation in the dose range of 2-50 Gy results in expression of NF-kappa B in human KG-1 myeloid leukemia cells and human B-lymphocyte precursor cells; the precise mechanism involved and the significance are not yet known.

Recent reports demonstrated that ionizing radiation in the dose range of 2-50 Gy results in expression of NF-kappa B in human KG-1 myeloid leukemia cells and human B-lymphocyte precursor cells; the precise mechanism involved and the significance are not yet known.

AbstractText.sentence: The present report demonstrates that even lower doses of ionizing radiation, 0.25-2.0 Gy, are capable of inducing expression of NF-kappa B in EBV-transformed 244B human lymphoblastoid cells.

event.clue: The present report demonstrates that even lower doses of ionizing radiation, 0.25-2.0 Gy, are capable of inducing expression of NF-kappa B in EBV-transformed 244B human lymphoblastoid cells.
The present report demonstrates that even lower doses of ionizing radiation, 0.25-2.0 Gy, are capable of inducing expression of NF-kappa B in EBV-transformed 244B human lymphoblastoid cells.

AbstractText.sentence: These results are in a dose range where the viability of the cells remains very high.
After exposure to 137Cs gamma rays at a dose rate of 1.17 Gy/min, a maximum in expression of NF-kappa B was seen at 8 h after a 0.5-Gy exposure.

event.clue: After exposure to 137Cs gamma rays at a dose rate of 1.17 Gy/min, a maximum in expression of NF-kappa B was seen at 8 h after a 0.5-Gy exposure.

AbstractText.sentence: Time-course studies revealed a biphasic time-dependent expression after 0.5-, 1- and 2-Gy exposures.

event.clue: Time-course studies revealed a biphasic time-dependent expression after 0.5-, 1- and 2-Gy exposures.

AbstractText.sentence: However, for each time examined, the expression of NF-kappa B was maximum after the 0.5-Gy exposure.

event.clue: However, for each time examined, the expression of NF-kappa B was maximum after the 0.5-Gy exposure.
However, for each time examined, the expression of NF-kappa B was maximum after the 0.5-Gy exposure.

AbstractText.sentence: The expression of the p50 and p65 NF-kappa B subunits was also shown to be regulated differentially after exposures to 1.0 and 2.0 Gy.

event.clue: The expression of the p50 and p65 NF-kappa B subunits was also shown to be regulated differentially after exposures to 1.0 and 2.0 Gy.
